attributes.additional_details: 'Isha' is one of the five daily prayers in Islam, a religion that is followed by approximately 3.8 million people in the UK. It is extremely offensive to name a storm after one of the five daily prayers in Islam or any other religious term. The name should be changed to something more appropriate that does not offend anybody's religion.
attributes.background: I am demanding that the Government/Parliament immediately change the name of 'Storm Isha'

rejection.details:
Decisions about naming storms are a matter for the Met Office, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about how storms are named here: https://www.metoffice.gov.uk/weather/warnings-and-advice/uk-storm-centre/index
